summary: Email correspondence from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding travel arrangements for two fact witnesses. The email discusses flight options and flexibility for the witnesses around their interview dates.

persons.name: Ted
persons.context: Appears as the Victim Witness Coordinator for the U.S. Attorney's Office, Southern District of New York, based on the signature block in the email.

events.title: Travel Arrangement Email for Witnesses
events.description: Email correspondence discussing flight and scheduling options for two fact witnesses to travel for an interview with the U.S. Attorney's Office.

locations: 1 St. Andrews Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was arranging travel for two fact witnesses in July 2019.
Travel options included flying down the day before the interview or the morning of, with flexibility to adjust travel after the interview if needed.
The correspondence indicates an active witness interview process was underway in the Epstein investigation at that time.
